content.text: Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) has seen fluctuations in its price, ranging from $86,004.22 to $93,976.68. Its market cap was recorded at approximately $11.95 billion, with a 24-hour trading volume of $204.94 million. The daily change was 0.0759%.

Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) has experienced price variations between $2,146.12 and $2,518.48. Its market cap was noted at $7.06 billion, with a 24-hour trading volume of $401.44 million. The daily change was 0.1088%.

categories.title: Recent Fixes and Improvements in ElizaOS

content.text: A fix was implemented for the GUI speech-to-text functionality to improve its reliability.
The client chat system received a fix to address issues affecting its performance.
A small fix was applied to the client to resolve minor issues.
Fixes were made to server APIs and the server itself to enhance stability and functionality.
A lock bump was performed to fix development-related issues.

A critical fix was applied to PostgreSQL connection handling, ensuring proper acquisition and release of connections. This prevents connection leaks, avoids pool exhaustion, and improves database reliability under high traffic conditions.

categories.title: AI Innovations in NFTs, Music, and Hacking

content.text: Magnus5202 aims to become the first AI-powered NFT collector to own $1M in assets, with the project built by Trekn_xyz.
AI can now generate high-quality classical sheet music that sounds incredibly good.
Eliza v2 Hacking.

A series of improvements and fixes were made to the graphical user interface (GUI). These include resolving issues with agent listing, creation, and editing, as well as fixing the start/stop agent API functionality. The start/stop mechanism was refactored to check the agent's runtime existence instead of relying on a database flag. Additionally, redundant UI components were removed to simplify the interface. While most UI functionalities are now operational, chat functionality will be addressed in a separate update.

Documentation improvements were made to enhance grammatical accuracy and consistency. Changes included refining phrasing for clarity, such as correcting the usage of 'audit' in security documentation and improving preposition use in branch protection guidelines. Additionally, Ukrainian documentation was updated to align with modern linguistic standards.

Development efforts focused on package improvements, particularly in the client chat system, along with the introduction of a new feature allowing proxy settings via the AGENT_PROXY environment variable. A total of 11 pull requests were merged, addressing five bug fixes and various enhancements, with contributions from nine developers.
Come and build with us.

One more week of obsessive building and I’ll respond to my DMs. Been intensely focused and will be streaming all week while working on agent development school. Trying a new format: 'What did you get done this week?'—5 bullet points. Excited to share what we've been working on.
A new feature, `registerMiddleware`, has been added. This update is similar to a previous implementation in PR #3648.

Linting and syntax errors in core swarm components have been fixed. The update includes corrections in the `updateWorld` function, `src/actions/settings.ts`, and `src/swarm/scenario.ts`. These improvements enhance code quality and maintainability.
Fixes issues related to deleting agents, ensuring smoother functionality.
Allows deletion operations to proceed even when encountering null values.

categories.title: Integration of Weather, Tavily Plugin in Slack and 6551 Research

content.text: A work-in-progress effort is underway to integrate the Weather and Tavily plugins into Slack.
Research is being conducted on integrating 6551, which is considered ideal for the project. However, challenges include the lack of widespread frontend support and the goal of being multichain.

categories.title: Character Studio Updates: Leaderboard Integration & NFT Marketplace

content.text: Character Studio, an open-source browser-based avatar toolkit by @m3org, is making significant progress. A new milestone introduces the ability to sell and purchase assets as NFTs, enabling on-chain ownership validation for loading traits and extending avatars through a marketplace.

Discussions are underway on integrating Character Studio with a leaderboard system. Once a method to associate wallets with GitHub accounts is established, contributors may receive skill capes or swag as rewards for their contributions.
